etymologies: early 20th century; earliest use found in Jerome K. Jerome (1859–1927), novelist and playwright. From German Bummel stroll, wander from bummeln

definitions: A leisurely stroll or journey; a wander, a saunter.

etymologies: early 20th century; earliest use found in Jerome K. Jerome (1859–1927), novelist and playwright. From German bummeln to stroll, wander, to laze, loaf from an imitative base seen also in †bummen to ring, sound, resound

definitions: To stroll or wander around in a leisurely way.
